problem_text:
a) An abstract group-theoretic property Σ is said to be radical (in our sense) if, in any group G, the subgroup Σ(G) generated by all normal Σ-subgroups is a Σ-subgroup itself (called the Σ-radical of G). A radical property Σ is said to be strongly radical if, for any group G, the factor-group G/Σ(G) contains no non-trivial normal Σ-subgroups. Is the property RN radical? strongly radical?
Sh. S. Kemkhadze
